Sharma to Marsh, 1 wide penalised by the ump for straying a bit too far outside off. Marsh realises he can do nothing and give Australia a run for the chase
Sharma to Marsh, no run just back of a length and outside off, Marsh shuffles across a tad and lets it through
Sharma to Marsh, no run short and wide, Marsh should have banished that to the point boundary. But since his feet aren't quite moving yet, he hits it straight to Jadeja

Sharma to Marsh, FOUR runs too easy. Ishant loses his line, Marsh makes sure it hurts with a little tickle down to the fine leg boundary. India are struggling to stay one side of the wicket in the first few overs
Sharma to Marsh, no run gets in line with a shortish delivery on off stump

Sharma to Marsh, no run that's better. Starts the ball on leg stump, which is more or less perfect for the angle across the left-hander. Marsh is squared up as he defends off the back foot. Now if he can get that ball fuller...

Sharma to Marsh, no run that was travelling, and Jadeja dives to his left to stop a certain boundary. Ishant strays short and wide and this time Marsh moves back and across to pounce. He had nearly placed it wide of the fielder, but a fit Jadeja is a tough man to beat

Barinder Sran to Finch, no run lovely bowling, that's what you want your new-ball bowler to do. Bowl fullish, get the batsman forward but not give him the drive, then coax a lifeless pitch into offering some seam away. Finch is beaten. Soundly

Barinder Sran to Finch, no run back-to-back beauties! Sran has begun an excellent over, starting on off stump, sucking the batsman into a front-foot defence, and beating him with seam away off the deck

Barinder Sran to Finch, no run

Barinder Sran to Finch, 1 leg bye a few inches fuller on middle and leg, which is the reason why Finch is caught in the crease and hurries to bring his bat down. So it comes through across the line and hits him in the pads. Loads of questions being asked

Barinder Sran to Marsh, no run and he finishes it by maintaining that teasing line just outside off to the left-hander too. A touch short, and hint of shape away. The only thing in favour of the batsman there was the length - short - so even though he is squared up, he can stay on the back foot and block
Sharma to Finch, 1 run tap and run cricket from Australia. Finch steps forward to put the ball into the covers and Marsh answers before Pandey running in could become a threat

Sharma to Marsh, 1 run ooh, Marsh is not sure about this, but Finch was the man running to the danger end and he was never in doubt. It's a back of a length ball that cramps the batsman, who gets an inside edge and the ball had stopped a foot or so away from Marsh. Ishant attempted a run out by kicking the ball at the stumps, but ends up stomping on it
Sharma to Finch, no run
Sharma to Finch, 1 wide hits a good length, ball kisses the pitch and seams down leg. Finch tries to use the pace and send it to the long leg boundary. Has to settle for a wide

Sharma to Finch, no run much better from Ishant, summons a good length ball at 135 kph and gets it to dart back into Finch. Batsman knows this period is dicey and he blocks into the midwicket region. Good little skirmish this
Sharma to Finch, 1 run gets across on onto off stump and flicks the ball to the man at long leg.

Sharma to Marsh, no run that's good. India needs to stay there to both batsman, perhaps at a fuller length. Marsh is squared up again, but because it is short, he can adjust and soften his hands to ensure the away swinger is easily blunted to point

Barinder Sran to Finch, no run shades of how he got out in Perth! Takes a fuller ball outside off and slugs it back down the ground. The bat turns on impact, because he was concentrating on power, no caught and bowled this time though
Barinder Sran to Finch, no run back of a length ball on off stump, blocked
Barinder Sran to Finch, no run sneaks in the short ball, Finch saw the length early and on instinct went for the pull, but on the left-armer's angle that's a tough shot. Misses it
Barinder Sran to Finch, no run fuller ball on off stump, tapped down the ground to mid-offf
Barinder Sran to Finch, 2 runs waits on the shortish delivery on off stump, moves across to off stump and pads it through midwicket
Barinder Sran to Finch, 1 run nicely done. Finch keeps to his back foot where both batsman have been comfortable and finds a single through midwicket.
Sharma to Finch, 1 run not quite the room he thought it had, but Finch adjusts well enough. Jumps up to get on top of the shortish delivery on fifth stump and chops it to short third man

Sharma to Finch, no run he is still getting a little nip into the right-hander, Finch's body language suggests. Back of a length ball on off stump, blocked

Sharma to Finch, no run inside edge ruins Ishant's appeal, and Finch survives a skiddy indipper. Pitches the ball up a touch more, catches Finch on the crease and hitting across the line towards wide mid-on. A little quicker than that and he would have had him
Sharma to Finch, no run slower and a bit wider outside off, perhaps to suck him into a false shot, Finch is wary of the trap and leaves
Sharma to Finch, no run back of a length and outside off, pushed into the covers

Barinder Sran to Marsh, no run Rohit continues to have an excellent match. Dives at midwicket to stop a Marsh pull that simply flew off the bat.
Yadav to Finch, no run oooh, never give Finch width. He was going for the awayswinger, and he does get some curl, but Finch timed it excellently to cover

Jadeja to Marsh, no run goes for the sweep, may have had a tickle on it because the umpire didn't call it a wide. Dhoni doesn't miss many behind the stumps to the spinner

Ashwin to Marsh, no run goes flatter and quicker on middle and leg, Marsh who was making room suddenly has none. defends

Yadav to Marsh, FOUR runs short, wide, hammered. And so early had he seen this buffey ball that Marsh has clomped the ball past mid-off

Yadav to Finch, 1 leg bye tickled away to fine leg, no bat though

Ashwin to Marsh, 1 run straying down leg, clipped through midwicket

Ran in a perfectly straight line, trouble happens on

Yadav to Finch, 1 run jumps back and flicks the shortish ball through to deep square leg
Ashwin to Finch, 1 run presses forward and pats the flighted delivery to long-on
Ashwin to Marsh, 1 run tries to cut the ball off himself, but the nudge towards mid-on beats him
Ashwin to Finch, 1 run waits for the shortish ball to turn into him and then ease it behind square leg

Ashwin to Marsh, 3 runs that's good shot. He's tried a similar shot before, but the late cut found point. Now Marsh backs away, cuts the ball, it turns away from the sweeper as it gathers speed as Dhoni indicated, but Ishant is a bit too slow
Ashwin to Finch, 1 run sweeps from outisde off to find a single at long leg
Ashwin to Marsh, no run flighted on middle, sent back down the pitch
Yadav to Finch, 1 run called early, response immediate, quick single pinched without the ball going three feet from the stumps

Yadav to Marsh, 1 run fullish on middle and leg, Marsh has only managed an inside edge onto pad, and yet he finds himself with a single to midwicket. Australia have decided no more dot balls. He's hurt himself as well, playing the flick. The bat just jammed onto his leg because he was hurried into the shot

Yadav to Finch, FOUR runs shuffles across and finds a smart boundary at long leg. Smart because he knows he is not going to get too many freebies outside off, but when he does get that one straying down leg, he makes sure to put it away

Yadav to Finch, SIX runs how about that! He reaches fifty with a shot that has the stamp of a batsman in plundering form. It was length, tailing into him, Finch moved his front leg across and a good old whip(lash) of the wrists takes the ball soaring over square leg

Ashwin to Marsh, 2 runs oh, that's a seriously risky single! Marsh had deflected the ball towards fine leg and is pulled into a quick single. They take on a fast bowler's arm - Yadav's - but Ashwin doesn't want to. He thinks this will be a direct hit and simply stepped away from the stumps. No backing up either, so they get a second when this should have
Ashwin to Marsh, 1 run short and wide outside off, cut away to Ishant at deep point. That's Marsh's fifty as well
Ashwin to Finch, 2 runs tossed up outside off and Finch loves the width on offer. Leans forward and chips the ball over extra cover. Rohit does well to keep the ball inside the boundary
Ashwin to Finch, FOUR runs ohhh, that is clever. He knew third man was up, he saw this short and wide and he delayed the cut shot just enough to pick the gap behind point
Ashwin to Finch, 1 run goes for the sweep and gets enough of an inside edge to find a single at fine leg
Ashwin to Marsh, 1 run flighted outside off, driven to long-off
Jadeja to Marsh, FOUR runs more punishment. Marsh gets deep in his crease and short-arm jabs a boundary over wide long-on
Jadeja to Marsh, 1 run flat, sharp delivery on middle and leg, picked through midwicket

Jadeja to Finch, FOUR runs brilliant! He has been buying his runs any way he could, from any edge he could so far, and having been there for so long, he has suddenly figured out the trick to his timing. Jumped back to make a shortish ball even shorter and cuts it behind point
Jadeja to Finch, FOUR runs disdain! That's what I saw in Finch's eyes as he watched the ball sail into the midwicket fence. Got to the pitch and all he did was power the ball away with his wrists
Jadeja to Finch, 1 run patted down the ground now that he's struck two fours earlier

Yadav to Marsh, 1 wide 141kph, that's been India's problem. They haven't been able to concentrate enough balls on one side of the wicket. This one is short and slips down leg. Marsh goes for the swivel pull and misses.

Yadav to Marsh, 1 run ooooh, Sran nearly had it! He nearly had a catch to remember until the end of time. Marsh had timed the leather off this short ball and the pull had four, maybe even six, all over it. Yadav to Marsh, no run back of a length on middle and leg, nudged to midwicket

Yadav to Marsh, 2 runs two they call after Marsh works it off his pads, and two they take even with one of the better Indian fielders on the square leg boundary. Pandey ran in and sent a flat throw to the bowler's end, but Finch had made it safely
Yadav to Marsh, 1 wide time for the swivel pull, but it was a little too far wide of him to connect

Yadav to Marsh, 1 run pat and run, this is excellent cricket from the Australians. And the best description of their pace between the pitch is that Finch and Marsh have been able to beat Jadeja at point
Jadeja to Marsh, 1 run tossed up on off stump, given a home at long-on

Jadeja to Finch, OUT that's the Test world-record holder! Rahane has pulled off a blinder at long-off! This was another that Finch thought he could smoke over extra, and so he did. Sharma to Marsh, no run lifter! And it needed a good nut like that to beat Marsh's late cut. Sharma to Marsh, 1 run shortish and outside off, run to point
Jadeja to Marsh, 1 run goes back and whips a shortish ball through to deep midwicket

Jadeja to Smith, 1 run eases the ball through the covers

Sharma to Marsh, OUT hurries him, leading edge, taken by Kohli! That's the bowling leader India want, the man who can dismiss the set batsman. Yadav to Bailey, 1 run steered comfortably to third man from the crease
Ashwin to Bailey, 1 run floated up on off, drilled to long-on with the turn
Ashwin to Smith, 2 runs chipped to long-on. Lovely batting, raced to the pitch and then just pushed the ball straight and stole a couple
Ashwin to Smith, 1 run flatter on leg, pushed with the full face of the bat to long-on
Ashwin to Bailey, 1 run well bowled this time, drags his length back just a touch. Bailey runs down and inside-edges to square leg
Ashwin to Smith, FOUR runs what a shot that is. Not a bad delivery at all. Flat on middle, Smith hurries back and makes room for himself. Clobbers the cut deftly in the gap behind point for four
Ashwin to Smith, 2 runs two more. Flat on leg, Smith tickles it into the leg side and races back for the second. Easily done
Yadav to Bailey, 1 run nope. It's a short one and Bailey has sliced it away to the sweeper cover

Yadav to Smith, no run how does he do that? Throws his front leg aside and goes to club the ball down the ground, when it was short of a length and barely a smidge outside off. Guess that's why he mistimed it
Yadav to Smith, 1 run now he jumps outside off and clips the very same ball - shortish and just outside off - to deep midwicket
Yadav to Bailey, 2 runs slapped away to Rahane on the point boundary, they go for the run on the throw and make it easily
Yadav to Bailey, no run full and seemed to tail in a touch, Bailey is not bothered at all as he hammers it to mid-off

Yadav to Bailey, 1 run oh, so simply, deftly, effortlessly done. All Bailey did was step forward and block a good length ball. That's playing to merits. But so well had he placed it - right between cover and mid-off - and so deftly had he touched it, that he is at the other end before any fielder can reach the ball. Brilliant.
Sharma to Bailey, 1 wide slower ball slides down the leg side, Bailey can't get the tickle he wants but can still be happy Australia get runs and an extra ball

Sharma to Bailey, FOUR runs jittery old shot from Bailey, and Ishant has a forlorn look on his face as he watches the ball disappear to the long leg boundary. What more can he do? Put the ball on a good length and made the batsman uncertain. Bailey attempts a defensive push, but he had no balance doing so and left a big gap to boot. Doesn't happen
Sharma to Bailey, no run a little legcutter from Ishant, which gets the edge as Bailey tries to put it to third man, but dies on its way to the keeper
Sharma to Bailey, 1 run a lot more width outside off and he is able to guide the ball through to deep third man

Sharma to Smith, FOUR runs smeared down the ground! Ishant got a hand to it - it could only have been a reflex catch and he has a history of not being able to pull those off - but testament to how little chance he had that is because Ashwin running back from mid-off can't get to it
Sharma to Smith, 1 run full and wide outside off - because Smith made it so by opening up his stance - carved to mid-off. Gee, he looks like a cave man swinging his club.
Sharma to Bailey, 1 run rises up to his ribcage, but Bailey gets on top of it and blunts it towards the square leg region
Yadav to Bailey, 1 run width offered and Bailey goes after it with a flay over point
Yadav to Smith, 1 run good length ball on middle and off, Smith puts it to long-on
Yadav to Bailey, 2 runs picks up the short ball and jabs it away between deep midwicket and deep long-on
Yadav to Bailey, 1 run shortish and sliding down, Bailey pulls to long leg

Yadav to Smith, OUT zips through and topples off! There's the danger of showing off your stumps to a fast bowler. He had hit a cut shot off a delivery on middle against Ashwin, tried to repeat that against Yadav, who bowls it on a good length and gets the ball to skid through to beat his self-inflicted and limited defences
Yadav to Maxwell, no run back of a length on off stump, blocked under his eyes
Jadeja to Bailey, 1 run down the track, gets a touch too close to the flat delivery outside off, and drives to long-off
Jadeja to Maxwell, no run goes back against the good length ball and blocks it
Jadeja to Maxwell, no run defends a fuller delivery on off stump without moving his feet. Premeditating that Jaddu will bowl flat
Jadeja to Maxwell, 2 runs leading edge flies away to the sweeper in the deep. Loads of wristwork behind the shot as he tries to lift the ball over the off side infield
Jadeja to Maxwell, 1 run pulls out the reverse sweep, and its only his fifth ball in. Manages to lob the infield again even though he didn't connect well
Jadeja to Bailey, no run leans forward and blocks on middle and leg

Yadav to Maxwell, 1 run ooh, that wasn't the most comfortable little guide to third man. Yadav slings down a 143 kph back of a length delivery right over off stump and it almost seemed like Maxwell had decided he would play no other shot
Yadav to Bailey, 1 run a little more width there which allows Bailey to carve the ball behind point
Yadav to Maxwell, 3 runs thumped over cover, and only Rahane and that large boundary over there prevents the four. Again, he barely moved his feet but was able to adjust with his hands
Yadav to Bailey, no run a little too short and just outside off, Bailey is hardly even interested

Yadav to Bailey, FOUR runs past the wicketkeeper! Hale and healthy nick as Bailey looks to hammer it down the ground, but the fuller ball ends up 180 degrees behind him. Dhoni went up, a tad slow, and to his right but can't reach it
Yadav to Bailey, 1 run slotted behind square leg to retain strike

Barinder Sran to Bailey, SIX runs picked up the slower ball and launched it into the crowd beyond long-off. Absolutely serene, and just about the perfect way to reach his fifty. Lovely stride forward, full swing of the arms, simply put away
Barinder Sran to Bailey, 1 run shortish and outside off, slower again, pulled to deep midwicket
Barinder Sran to Maxwell, no run 116 kph, that time the offcutter works because he puts it on a good length and slants it across the new batsman, instead of the set one. Maxwell is beaten
Barinder Sran to Maxwell, 1 run back to normal pace on middle and leg, Maxwell clips it away to to long leg

Barinder Sran to Bailey, FOUR runs with him bowling slower balls third man was in and the straight fielders were back. The problem here was Sran's slower ball was short and wide and Bailey simply tucked in with a cut shot over the infield
Barinder Sran to Bailey, 1 run good length ball on middle and leg, nudged into the midwicket region

Sharma to Bailey, no run almost! Bailey prefers to stay beside the ball, which pitches on a good length and holds its line. No luck with the edge, worse luck with the off stump, all it eventually hits is Dhoni's gloves and it sounds so hollow as India's hopes slip
Sharma to Bailey, 1 run neat little nudge through the midiwcket region. There's only on man up in the circle at that region
Sharma to Maxwell, 2 runs picks up the short ball early enough to pull it miles in front of square. Manish Pandey is the man running across from midwicket and needs to put in the full-length dive
Sharma to Maxwell, 1 run just back of a length on off stump, Maxwell gets in line with it and blocks. Once that's done he jogs the single as the ball meanders to long-on
Sharma to Bailey, 2 runs fullish on middle and leg, clipped to deep square leg and they pinch a second.

Sharma to Bailey, 1 run sees the width, uses it to his advantage as he finds a single to deep third man. Keeping up with the required rate just by running their runs. Must be demoralising for a fielding team especially after putting up 300-plus
Jadeja to Bailey, 1 run flighted outside off, driven to long-off
Jadeja to Maxwell, 1 run round-armed dart on middle and leg, cut away strongly to deep point
Jadeja to Bailey, no run a grunt from Jadeja as he pushes a good length ball on middle, defended
Jadeja to Bailey, 1 run down the track and drives the fuller ball on off stump to long-off
Jadeja to Maxwell, 2 leg byes did that get a little boot from Maxwell? Yep. Fired into the pads, goes for the standing swipe to long leg but it is too quick for him
Jadeja to Maxwell, 1 run 101 kph, on middle and leg, picked away behind square leg

Sharma to Maxwell, 1 run excellent work from Jadeja at point. India are still trying. It shows in the batsman trying to cramp the batsman up, it shows in this big dive to his right as Jaddu stops a possible second run. But this is such a lovely batting deck. Just skims onto the bat with no sideways movement
Sharma to Bailey, no run patted into the covers as ishant goes for middle and leg and gets it to rise towards his thighs.
Sharma to Bailey, 1 wide full and down leg, that's almost predictable considering India trying to stymie the runscoring by denying width
Sharma to Bailey, FOUR runs Pandey signals it was four, but the way Bailey picked up that length ball and sent it soaring, I thought it was 12. Brilliant ball-striking.
Sharma to Bailey, 2 runs Jadeja tracks it over his head, he is running back as hard as he could, sticks out a hand in desperation but the outside edge off a cramped up cut shot beats him.
Sharma to Bailey, 1 run backs away, but Ishant follows him with a short ball, pulled to wide long-on
Sharma to Maxwell, 1 wide perhaps he was preempting Maxwell making room, because that's just a shocker of a slower ball down leg. Ishant's eighth wide of the day
Sharma to Maxwell, 1 run short of a length and outside off, clipped through midwicket with a gentle roll of the wrists
Barinder Sran to Maxwell, 1 run short ball, swivel pulled to long leg

Barinder Sran to Bailey, 1 run 109 kph offcutter just outside off, dabbed to short third man and they trot over for a single. Possible sign that India have given up because there should be no run there
Barinder Sran to Maxwell, 1 run full toss, wide outside off, Maxwell looks to beat Ishant at short third man for his first boundary of the day, but he is unable to do so
Barinder Sran to Bailey, 1 run goes for the short ball outside off, pulled to deep square leg
Barinder Sran to Maxwell, no run 126 kph, stays inside the line and looks to punch a short of a length delivery through the covers. No contact
Barinder Sran to Maxwell, no run that's a 95 kph slower ball, Maxwell moves inside the line to lift it over the wicketkeeper. There is not enough pace to pull it off
Yadav to Bailey, 1 run inside edge to a 140 kph delivery just outside off, Bailey was all set for bash it through the covers. Has to settle for a single to Dhoni
Yadav to Maxwell, 2 runs full on middle and leg, Maxwell slaps it down the ground and gets a couple. Meanwhile, 300 up for the fourth time in four innings this series

Yadav to Maxwell, 2 runs full and outside off, Maxwell plants his back leg outside off and simply swings as hard as he could. So whilst he gets elevation, he has very little power. But massive luck as he splits three men tracking the skier down
Yadav to Maxwell, no run backs away to clatter a 142 kph short ball way outside off down the ground. Spectacularly beaten
Yadav to Maxwell, FOUR runs there is his first of the match, and scores are level. It's a short ball, Maxi camps back and pummels it wide of long-on

Yadav to Maxwell, 1 run patted to point, straight to Jaddu, would have been out had he hit the stumps, but he does not and Bailey gets across for an unbeaten fifty and the Australian win. That's the best chase at the Gabba as well, with an over to spare and nearly no doubt about the result.

"It's always disappointing. At the end of the day, no matter how much you score. I love playing here. The wickets are good, you always get value for your shots and that's what I want to do. Once I'm in, I feel good enough to score big. Overall pleased with my form, but disappointing not to win. Looking forward to Melbourne now"

We had been warned of this, but it is still a little scary that 300 is being gunned down like a walk in the park.
